conclusion: Analyze the given pressure-volume (P-V) diagram to determine work done by the external environment on the gas during process C to A.
Process C to A is a horizontal line from volume V_C = 5 L to volume V_A = 2 L at constant pressure P_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
For a process at constant pressure, work done by/on the gas is given by W = -P ΔV.
ΔV = V_A - V_C = 2 L - 5 L = -3 L.
Substitute values into the formula: W = -(1 x 10^5 Pa) x (-3 L).
Convert liters to cubic meters: W = -(1 x 10^5 Pa) x (-3 x 10^-3 m^3).
Calculate the work: W = 3 x 10^2 J.
The positive sign indicates work is done by the external environment on the gas during process C to A.
The work done by the external environment on the gas during process C to A is 300 J.
